recipe_name: Instant Pot Split Pea Soup with Ham
ingredients: 1 ham bone (or 1 smoked ham hock, or 6 oz. diced deli ham)
1 lb. dry split peas, sorted and rinsed
6 cups low sodium chicken stock (or veggie stock/water/mixture)
Kosher salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Turn pressure cooker to 'sauté' setting. Melt butter and sauté onion, celery, and carrots for about 5 minutes, until softened.
Add split peas, chicken stock, ham bone/hock/diced ham, and bay leaves. Turn off 'sauté' function.
Seal the lid, ensure valve is on 'sealing,' and set to manual high pressure for 15 minutes.
Allow pressure to naturally release for 10-15 minutes, then quick release the remaining pressure.
If using a ham bone or hock, remove it from the soup, shred the meat, and return the meat to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator (1 week) or freezer (6 months).
